messages: 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:01): Is the Chromium team planning to replace certain parts of WebKit over time? E.g. http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/list?can=2&q=label:newhttp
4085cea89597242ce9454ecd8c048e76 (14:03): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: webkit doesn't provide a network stack
4085cea89597242ce9454ecd8c048e76 (14:04): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: it expects the platform to provide those, just as it expects the platform port to provide the front end API
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:09): ah, so it's similar to Skia? ta
4085cea89597242ce9454ecd8c048e76 (14:10): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: chrome effectively is its own platform
4085cea89597242ce9454ecd8c048e76 (14:10): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: i have a dream that one day they may contribute to the engine itself
4085cea89597242ce9454ecd8c048e76 (14:11): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: but my experience with adobe and nokia has lowered my expectation for such things :-/
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:31): CSS Namespaces Module in CR, a test suite for it is ready and I was never forced to work on either. That I dislike namespaces is such a myth :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:36): how did the WebKit XBL2 & MathML SoC projects go?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:38): if they were a success there would probably have been a blog post...
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:39): afaik the Web Forms 2.0 project only landed autofocus, bit disappointing overall
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:41): where did Chrome's old http come from?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:43): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: It's new as well
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:43): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9, heh, good question :)
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:46): reappears
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:46): sorry this system wasn't set to autojoin whatwg
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:46): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: cpst's project morphed into the general "make jsc faster"
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:46): rather than the pattern matching stuff
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:46): or tile matching
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:46): which is what frostbyte actually does
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:47): frostbyte == khtml's new js engine

47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:48): the svg filters guy accomplished very little alas (which is not surprising given the level he was at -- i need to understand the us education system better i don't know what any of the crazy names mean)
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:48): keishi got the firebug api's going
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:48): even doing the work to jsc to make line number info get passed in appropriately
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:48): the xbl one didn't really get to completion
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:49): i think that's it
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (14:54): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8, wasn't there Web Forms 2.0 and MathML as well?
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:55): i don't think we had sufficient slots for the mathml person
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:55): and yes there was a webforms 2 guy
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:55): however based on my complete absence of rememberance i suspect he may have disappeared into the ether
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:56): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: :-( that doesn't sound good
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:56): i assume he failed
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:56): but i honestly don't know for sure
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:56): should get around to learn C++ so he can take part in two years time
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:56): :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:56): *learning
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:56): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: you cna work on the inspector
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:56): html+js+css
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:57): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: That doesn't help me learn C++ though :)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:57): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I had hello world -level C++ experience when I started my summer coding
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:58): notes the first item on his summer to-do list was ship Anolis 1.0
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:58): That still hasn't happened.
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:58): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: you were GSoC type person?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (14:59): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: I was in 2006, but it was not Google's but a thing imitating SoC
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (14:59): ah righto
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (14:59): is too young for GSoC
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:00): (I had much better payment terms that what one gets with SoC)
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:01): no, checkpoints instead of all or nothing at the end
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:02): GSoC has a midway checkpoint
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:02): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: Like, "Does it do less than when you started?"
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:02): oh. is that a new thing?
b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9 (15:02): (I thought they didn't have checkpoints in 2005)
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:04): b8810fee2f4a71f849f3f7409546d1d9: maybe -- i haven't done anything in previous years
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:23): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: You still want to get me on standardssuck.org for HTTP5?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:38): about SVG in HTML - obviously <object> doesn't suffice, but why ?
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:39): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: standardssuck.org is true to its name and has only flash video :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:40): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: Actually, FLV is fully documented nowadays :P
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:42): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Adobe Flash Player isn't
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:43): 7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6: Sure, but you can just get the FLV and download that :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:44): And SWF is open too
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:44): you bet how often i look around in the source code ...
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:46): i meant it often comes to me that i look through the source of a web site to find the embedded FLV's url
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:46): Well, get someone to implement <http://www.adobe.com/devnet/swf/pdf/swf_file_format_spec_v9.pdf> :P
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:47): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: open source != standard :D
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:47): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: What open source impls are there? There is no open source impl. or standard! :P
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:47): Just a spec! :P
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:48): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: isn't there swfdec or some such?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:48): 47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8: Nothing useful in the real world :P
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:48): righto
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:48): would much rather flash just died
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:48): Partial impls, but no full impls
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:48): Me too, but it won't.
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:48): but i dont' see that happening in the near future
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:49): like IE it is a bain on our existence
47223c0fa41aa7e167a2d1fd2740cbb8 (15:49): (not that gecko and webkit haven't left bits of cruft all over the web)
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:49): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: gnash ppl already said that this docs don't help
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (15:49): wants Web 2.0 :P
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:50): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: you are wrong here. this channel is the web 3.11 workgroup

7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (15:51): also, embracing and extending it ;)
